FOTO: Zapadlo pet centimetrov snega, vremenarji svarijo
Čaka nas deževen dan.
05 Nov 2019, 08:38 by T. V.



Snega po nižinah še ni pričakovati. FOTO: Roman Šipić



Kredarico prekriva bela odeja. FOTO: Arso


LJUBLJANA – Na Kredarici je v zadnjih 12 urah zapadlo pet centimetrov novega snega. Višina snežne odeje okoli koče pod Triglavom je tako debela 15 centimetrov, kažejo podatki Agencije RS za okolje (Arso).Snega pod približno 2000 metri v bližnji prihodnosti ni pričakovati, lahko pa pričakujemo obilne padavine. Vremenoslovci so za večji del Slovenije razglasili oranžni, drugi najvišji alarm. Do torka pozno zvečer pričakujemo obilnejše padavine z dolgotrajnimi nalivi. Krajevno bo v zahodni, osrednji, južni in jugovzhodni Sloveniji predvidoma padlo od 50 do okoli 100 litrov na kvadratni meter, v Julijskih Alpah lokalno do okoli 150 litrov na kvadratni meter, drugod pa od 20 do okoli 50 litrov na kvadratni meter dežja.


Kredarico prekriva bela odeja. FOTO: Arso

 Na cestah na območju Severne Primorske je zaradi močnega vetra velika nevarnost padanja dreves.Po podatkih Oddelka za hidrološke napovedi imajo trenutno reke s povirjem v Julijskih Alpah, v Kamniško Savinjskih Alpah ter v Idrijsko Cerkljanskem in Škofjeloškem hribovju ter v porečju Vipave velike pretoke. V zgornjem Posočju se posamezne manjše reke že razlivajo. Reke v Prekmurju ter Pesnica imajo male pretoke, pretoki večine drugih rek so srednji. Dopoldne bodo reke v zgornjem Posočju še naraščale, popoldne pa bodo začele upadati. Čez dan bodo ponovno začele naraščati reke drugod po Sloveniji in dosegle velike pretoke. Največje pretoke bodo dosegle v večernih urah in v noči na sredo. Ob tem lahko pride do razlivanj posameznih rek v več delih države, zlasti v osrednji in južni Sloveniji. Ob močnejših krajevnih nalivih lahko hitro narastejo tudi hudourniški vodotoki. Gladina morja bo v sredo ob jutranji plimi povišana.Najvišje dnevne temperature bodo od 11 do 17, na Primorskem do 20 stopinj Celzija. V prvem delu noči bo dež večinoma ponehal. Jutri bo na vzhodu deloma sončno in povečini suho, drugod bodo občasno krajevne padavine, deloma plohe, na zahodu tudi kakšna nevihta. Najnižje jutranje temperature bodo od 4 do 10, ob morju okoli 13, najvišje dnevne od 11 do 17, v Gornjesavski dolini okoli 7 stopinj.Obilne padavine na današnji dan smo imeli v Sloveniji tudi pred leti. Leta 1966 je ponekod zapadlo več kot 300 mm dežja, leta 1980 pa je do jutra marsikje po nižinah in dolinah v 48 urah zapadlo rekordno veliko snega za začetek novembra. Čez dan je bilo še nekaj padavin, a je zaradi otoplitve v višinah pod 2000 metrov sneg povsod prešel v dež. V Podbrezju na Gorenjskem je sneg segal 57 centimetrov visoko, v Bohinjski Bistrici 56 cm, v Črni vasi na Barju 54 cm, v Cerkljah na Gorenjskem in Škofji Loki 44 cm, v Cerknici 41 cm, v Bovcu 36 cm, na postaji Ljubljana Bežigrad 30 cm, v Mariboru 25 cm in v Ilirski Bistrici ter Črnomlju 24 cm.V četrtek bo več sončnega vremena, nastale bodo le posamezne plohe. V petek bo v zahodnih krajih oblačno s padavinami, na vzhodu bo deloma sončno in v glavnem suho. Tudi v nadaljevanju bo prevladovalo oblačno vreme z občasnimi padavinami, ki jih bo več in bodo pogostejše v zahodni polovici države. Najvišje dnevne temperature bodo do nedelje okoli 12, kasneje pa okoli 10 stopinj.

PHOTO: Five inches of snow fall, weather forecasters warn
It's a rainy day.
05 Nov 2019, 08:38 by T.V.



Snow is not expected in the lowlands. PHOTO: Roman Sipic



The lender is covered by a white blanket. PHOTO: Arso


LJUBLJANA - Five inches of new snow have fallen in Kredarica in the last 12 hours. The height of the snow blanket around the hut below Triglav is 15 centimeters thick, according to data from the Environmental Agency of the Republic of Slovenia (Arso). Snow is not expected below 2000 meters in the near future, but heavy rainfall can be expected. Weather scientists have declared the second highest alarm in most of Slovenia. By late Tuesday, heavy rainfall is expected with heavy rainfall. Locally, in western, central, southern and southeastern Slovenia, it is expected to fall from 50 to about 100 liters per square meter, in the Julian Alps locally to about 150 liters per square meter, and elsewhere from 20 to about 50 liters per square meter of rain.


The lender is covered by a white blanket. PHOTO: Arso

On the roads in the North Primorska region, due to strong winds, there is a high risk of falling trees. According to the Hydrological Forecast Section, rivers in the Julian Alps, in the Kamnik Savinja Alps, in the Idrija Cerkno and Skofja Loka Hills and in the Vipava River Basin have high flows. In the upper Posočje individual smaller rivers are already spilled. The rivers in Prekmurje and Pesnica have small flows, the flows of most other rivers are medium. In the morning, the rivers in the upper Soča Valley will continue to grow, and in the afternoon they will start to decline. During the day, rivers elsewhere in Slovenia will start rising again and reach high flows. They will reach maximum flows in the evening and on Wednesday nights. This can lead to spills of individual rivers in several parts of the country, especially in central and southern Slovenia. With heavy local rainfall, torrential watercourses can also grow rapidly. The sea level will rise on Wednesday morning with high tides. The highest daily temperatures will be from 11 to 17, in the Littoral to 20 degrees Celsius. In the first part of the night, the rain will mostly be over. Tomorrow will be partly sunny in the east and mostly dry, with occasional heavy rainfall in the east and partly sunny in the west. The lowest morning temperatures will be from 4 to 10, the seaside around 13, the highest daily from 11 to 17, in the Upper Sava Valley about 7 degrees. We had heavy rainfall today in Slovenia years ago. In 1966, more than 300 mm of rain fell in some places, and by 1980, a record high amount of snow had fallen through the lowlands and valleys in the early hours of November. There was some rain during the day, but as a result of the warming at altitudes below 2000 meters, the snow had turned into rain everywhere. In Podbrezje in the Gorenjska region snow was 57 cm high, in Bohinjska Bistrica 56 cm, in Črna vas on Barje 54 cm, in Cerklje in Gorenjska and Škofja Loka 44 cm, in Cerknica 41 cm, in Bovec 36 cm, at Ljubljana Bežigrad station 30 cm, in Maribor 25 cm and in Ilirska Bistrica and Črnomelj 24 cm. On Thursday there will be more sunny weather, only individual plots will be created. On Friday it will be cloudy in the western places, partly sunny and mostly dry in the east. The following will also be dominated by cloudy weather with occasional rainfall that will increase and be more frequent in the western half of the country. Maximum daily temperatures will be around 12 degrees by Sunday and about 10 degrees later.
